timeline.bodyText: nit: A page may not necessarily have to be returned from a service.
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -6,26 +6,25 @@
 import com.azure.core.util.IterableStream;
 
 /**
- * Represents Page from service that has reference to next set of one or more pages,
- * such a reference is known as continuation token.
- *
- * @param <C> Type of the continuation token
- * @param <T> Type of the elements in the page
+ * Represents a page returned from a service, this page may contain a reference to additional pages known as a

timeline.bodyText: Same here, the page can be retrieved from any source.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Instead of server's default, you can change this to source's default page size.
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:

the page elements type */ @FunctionalInterface public interface PageRetriever { /** - * Retrieve a set of one or more pages starting from the page identified by - * the given continuation token. + * Retrieves one or more pages starting from the page identified by the given continuation token. * - * @param continuationToken the token identifying the page set, a {@code null} - * value indicate that retrieve pages from the beginning - * @param pageSize the preferred number of items per page, a {@code null} value - * indicate that client prefer server's default page size - * @return a Flux that emits one or more pages + * @param continuationToken Token identifying which page to retrieve, passing {@code null} indicates to retrieve + * the first page. + * @param pageSize The number of items to retrieve per page, passing {@code null} will use the server's default

timeline.message: Removed service references from APIs that don't correlate to a service
